A polymer is a material that has a large molecular structure composed entirely of rings or chains of many distinctive repeating units (monomers). To simplify ...
Oct 13, 2017 — Polymers are large molecules made by bonding (chemically linking) a series of building blocks. The word polymer comes from the Greek words for “many parts.”
Polymers formed by a straightforward linking together of monomer units, with no loss or gain of material, are called addition polymers or chain-growth polymers.

results.t: Types, Classification, Properties, and Uses of Polymers
results.p: A polymer is a large molecule or a macromolecule, which essentially is a combination of many subunits. The term polymer in Greek means 'many parts'.
The physical and chemical properties of polymers include tensile strength, durability, viscoelasticity, reactivity, melting point, conductivity, and so on.
